greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of e.g.f. exp(k*x)*BesselI(0,2*x).
comment: A(n,k) is the k-th binomial transform of A126869 evaluated at n.
formula: A(n,k) is the coefficient of x^n in the expansion of (1 + k*x + x^2)^n.
A(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..floor(n/2)} k^(n-2*j) * binomial(n,2*j) * binomial(2*j,j). - _Seiichi Manyama_, May 04 2019
T(n,k) =  (1/Pi) * Integral_{x = -1..1} (k - 2 + 4*x^2)^n/sqrt(1 - x^2) dx  = (1/Pi) * Integral_{x = -1..1} (k + 2 - 4*x^2)^n/sqrt(1 - x^2) dx. - _Peter Bala_, Jan 27 2020
mathematica: Table[Function[k, n! SeriesCoefficient[Exp[k x] BesselI[0, 2 x], {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 11}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
Table[Function[k, SeriesCoefficient[1/Sqrt[(1 + 2 x - k x) (1 - 2 x - k x)], {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 11}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Sep 20 2017
